posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.91 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

This release covers our holiday period and most of the changes are under the hood, so our release notes this week haven’t changed:

  • Additional interface improvements, including an updated layout and Liquid Glass playback controls in the media viewer.

We do continue to make improvements to Backups, though, and your early feedback is still crucial for us as we roll this out to a broader audience.

Please continue to report any issues you encounter!

When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you’re experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.89 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.91.0.1278-beta

159 new commits since 7.89.0.1245-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.90 [1]

  • Glass Play button for the videos in media viewer. [2]

  • Disable "dark mode" override for media viewer on iOS 26. [3]

  • Update to Xcode 26.1.1 [4]

  • Workaround for chat view title not always accurately choosing text color. [5]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.86.8 [6]

  • Update release notes [7]

  • Add timestamps for pin message send & receive [8]

  • Migrate iPad device transfer to new transfer flow [9]

  • Animate banner fade in for pinned messages [10]

  • Handle repeat pin messages [11]

  • Fix missing pinned messages view controller background on iOS 18 [12]

  • Move attachment creation/pasteboard logic [13]

  • Hoist some attachment files into SignalUI [14]

  • Drop TSAttachment migration [15]

  • Remove unused scripts [16]

  • Cleanup in SignalApp [17]

  • Hook up unpin button in pinned message details view [18]

  • Use black background in media viewer when top and bottom panels are hidden. [19]

  • Deprecate storedShouldStartExpireTimer [20]

  • Introduce ExpirationJob, use for DMs, Stories, and CallRecords [21]

  • Fetch whole story record instead of just timestamp [22]

  • Fix string for turning off admin only group update [23]

  • Line wrap conversation settings header buttons [24]

  • Tweak media presentation/dismiss animations. […] [25]

  • Fix crash loop detector logic when upgrading [26]

  • Add limits when handling registration errors [27]

  • Support to expire pinned messages [28]

  • Backups for pinned messages [29]

  • Pinned messages build flag internal [30]

  • Call Quality Survey UI [31]

  • Inline EncryptedStickerMetadata constructors [32]

  • Improve media viewer opening/closing animations. [33]

  • pinned message polish [34]

  • Reload reg phone number field when rate limited [35]

  • Add correct accessibility labels for system messages [36]

  • Truncate long pinned messages [37]

  • Require a Retry-After header for automatic retries [38]

  • Don’t allow retries if we can’t request a code [39]

  • Focus the most recent visible message in the CVC for voiceover [40]

  • Mitigate handling of HDR screenshots [41]

  • Update some stories subviews to be dark theme [42]

  • Use native search bar in contact picker [43]

  • Support automatic macro mode in the QR code scanner [44]

  • Fix Xcode 26.2 build [45]

  • Remove OWSSearchBar [46]

  • Fix incorrect animation when opening a video from chat. […] [47]

  • Fix emoji picker not working after device rotation [48]

  • Try different animation parameters when opening/closing media. [49]

  • Fix …PhoneNumberInputViewDelegate.didChange(…) [50]

  • Workaround concurrency issues in conversation view controller […] [51]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.61.0 [52]

  • Update release notes [53]

  • Update translations [54]

  • Bump version to 7.91 [55]

  • Simplify and consolidate "DB Corruption" handling [56]

  • Fix safety number scanner styling [57]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.86.9 [58]

  • Remove Mantle [59]

  • Fix iPad pinned message details view [60]

  • Remove NSCoding for InstalledSticker/StickerPack [61]

  • Use native background colors on iOS 15 [62]

  • Use dynamic colors in context menus and emoji pickers [63]

  • Don't resume system audio when scrubbing video [64]

  • Reset pinned message index if its out of range [65]

  • Add fade out animations for final pinned message [66]

  • Remove unused code [67]

  • Clean up some sticker methods [68]

  • Reduce verbosity of calling code in tests [69]

  • Increase timeout when setting up tests [70]

  • More bootstrapped build-and-run and test reporting in CI [71]

  • Remove OwnedAttachmentBuilder from Link Previews, Stories [72]

  • Remove some Theme colors [73]

  • Remove OwnedAttachmentBuilder from MessageStickerManager [74]

  • Remove unnecessary code in/around quoted replies [75]

  • Remove OwnedAttachmentBuilder from QuotedReplyManager [76]

  • Rename QuotedReplyManagerImpl -> QuotedReplyManager [77]

  • Remove OwnedAttachmentBuilder from ContactShareManager [78]

  • Avoid "builder" pattern for incoming Poll Create [79]

  • Remove OwnedAttachmentBuilder [80]

  • Use failIfThrows in BackupAttachmentDownloadStore [81]

  • Build fix for calling pattern in OWSIncomingSentMessageTranscript after rebase [82]

  • Make AttachmentManager's default API one-by-one instead of array [83]

  • Introduce swiftformat [84]

  • Calling: Add more logging for AVAudioSession and CallKit [85]

  • Enable swiftformat for the NSE and SAE [86]

  • Replace switch with simple comparison [87]

  • Fix warning that swiftformat is already installed [88]

  • Fix download state appearing incorrectly [89]

  • Update to Xcode 26.2 [90]

  • tap pin icon for menu [91]

  • Always run the same migration code [93]

  • De-protocolize RecipientFetcher [94]

  • Proper clipping of the media view during presentation/dismiss animations. [95]

  • Fix typo [96]

  • Remove unused code [97]

  • Fix bad merge causing images being clipped during dismiss animation. [98]

  • Add support for JPEG XL [100]

  • Always resize large images [101]

  • Remove redundant code [102]

  • Remove areReadReceiptsEnabledCached [103]

  • Remove references to unused “ud-chat” domain [104]

  • Remove unused code [105]

  • Remove TimeGatedBatch.processAll(Sync) method [106]

  • Migrate sessions to a dedicated table [107]

  • Fix pinned message banner height & animations [108]

  • Increase icon size in sticker category bar from 24 to 28. [109]

  • Use an enum for processBatch’s return value [110]

  • Use failIfThrows in some Attachments code, remove unused code [116]

  • Run swiftformat . [117]

  • Run swiftformat . again [118]

  • Remove redundant error wrapping [119]

  • Use failIfThrows in Blocked*Stores [120]

  • Remove unused clearProfileWhitelist method [122]

  • Fix pinned message layout constraints [123]

  • Catch and add a sheet for NotRegisteredError in BackupSettings [124]

  • Pinning is not supported for gift badges [125]

  • Rename SenderKeyStore → OldSenderKeyStore [126]

  • Remove …SKDMInfo method [127]

  • Remove make test command [128]

  • Make sticker packs toolbar a bit wider. [129]

  • Drop pin messages for gift badges [130]

  • Show pin success for 404 [131]

  • Clean up code for supported attachment types [132]

  • Ignore invalid Attachment instances in list-media [133]

  • Don’t dismiss view controller when unpinning a message from details view [134]

  • Rename validateContents methods [135]

  • Don't coalesce pinned message view button [136]

  • wallpaper not showing up on first load with pinned messages [137]

  • Migrate whitelist to SignalRecipient.status [138]

  • Send sync message to linked devices when a pin expires [139]

  • extra long highlight box when long pressing message in pinned message view [140]

  • Make OrphanedAttachmentRecord.id non-optional [141]

  • Use failIfThrows in OrphanedAttachmentStore [142]

  • De-protocolize PendingAttachment [143]

  • De-protocolize RevalidatedAttachment [144]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.86.10 [145]

  • Clean up attachment validating backfilling [146]

  • voiceover prefix for pinned message banner [147]

  • Remove JPEG XL outside of transcoding flow [148]

  • Simplify image compression flow [149]

  • Remove WebP workaround that’s not required [150]

  • Deprotocolize AttachmentStore [151]

  • Rename AttachmentStoreImpl.swift [152]

  • Avoid using autoclosure to cache AttachmentReference in AttachmentOffloadingManager [153]

  • Change copy for admin permissions if pinned message send is enabled [154]

  • Avoid using autoclosure in BackupAttachmentDownloadEligibility [155]

  • Enable pinned message receive [156]

  • Update translations [157]

  • Handle pinning with remotely deleted messages [158]

  • Empty commit to make a new build [159]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.89.0.1245-beta…7.91.0.1278-beta

Localization changes

No localization changes fit in character limit. You can view the full comparison to 7.89.0.1245-beta so far here. Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.90 release

posts.cooked:
Moving a picture without fully closing it makes the outline of the description disappear

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.91.0/441b195fe02143775c407858980fda516b7fa56c619f8ad70e4d5b6d912df627.zip

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
Hey all!

I shared a photo via the share sheet but cancelled while the upload happened. Then I went into the app where the indicator still showed uploading. I edited the picture because I had a typo in the caption (this was my initial reason for the cancellation). After the edit the picture was uploaded successfully (group chat) but it showed that it never arrived for any participants. After forwarding all people received the image immediately.

So far my memories of the event. The initial process took place a few hours ago, only now I realised the message, that the message was never sent to the group members.

Debug log: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.91.0/6a2ede8f1304379cdb7b539e3d18759c9f25e69bf6b7720500fba4e8ed704721.zip

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
I managed to recreate this event. This time in a 1:1 chat.

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.91.0/4b4a409e22c47d015c6ad66c0f00dda89c16066c06d02b10cc44b3a04ce7bd1a.zip

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Thanks for reporting! We made some changes to bring our media-dismiss gesture in line with the default Apple behaviors, which will address this issue in the next beta.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Very interesting – thanks for reporting. We’ll take a look.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Can you please post the “message ID” of the messages in question? You can find it by going to the “message details” view, then long-pressing on the “sent” time. It should copy a timestamp like 1768258240 to your pasteboard.

Additionally, I’m curious if the original send (with the edit) actually failed to be sent to the other members. Can you confirm that none of them saw the image until you re-sent it?

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
sashaweiss-signal:

Can you please post the “message ID” of the messages in question? You can find it by going to the “message details” view, then long-pressing on the “sent” time. It should copy a timestamp like 1768258240 to your pasteboard.

Message ID: 1768247169977 (it’s the one from my first post with the group chat)

sashaweiss-signal:

Additionally, I’m curious if the original send (with the edit) actually failed to be sent to the other members. Can you confirm that none of them saw the image until you re-sent it?

Two of three people in the group confirmed, to have only received the message once.

EDIT: I just noticed, that the mentioned message (sent on my phone) is not synchronised to my Signal Desktop instance. Only the forwarded picture is present there.

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
The message of the 1:1 chat was now delivered to the other person. For me, the message is marked as received and read.

The group message on the other hand looks unchanged: sent but not delivered to anyone.

Message ID of the 1:1 chat message: 1768253061675

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.91.0/7f5cd7e1210579031e68b0a153e92e0ea7d0a5ff10aa5a0fe86e2e3ed7433e5b.zip

On my desktop, only the forwarded message is shown. So no change there.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.92 release.
